intro: Mallotus phongnhaensis, commonly known as Phong Nha mountain holly, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Phong Nha-Ke Bang National Park in Vietnam. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
